trans:
Typically, it is mild, self-limited, and prominent.
•Infections (bacterial, viral, fungal, parasitic) •Trauma(blunt and penetrating)
Trauma (blunt and penetrating) Infections (bacterial, viral, fungal, parasitic)
• Physical or chemical agents (e.g., thermal injury, such as burns or frostbite; irradiation; toxicity from certain environmental chemicals)
Physical or chemical agents (e.g., thermal injury such as burns or frostbite; irradiation; toxicity from certain
environmental chemicals)
• Foreign bodies (splinters, dirt, sutures), Even some endogenous substances such substances include
urate crystals (in the disease gout), and cholesterol crystals (in atherosclerosis).
Foreign bodies (splinters, dirt, sutures), even some endogenous substances. Such substances include urate crystals (in the disease gout) and cholesterol crystals (in atherosclerosis).
• Immune reactions (also called hypersensitivity as in allergies, these reactions tend to be persistent and difficult to cure, are often associated with chronic inflammation
Immune reactions (also called hypersensitivity as in allergies; these reactions tend to be persistent and difficult to cure and are often associated with chronic inflammation).
• Tissue necrosis, including ischemia (as in a myocardial infarct).
